meanings.definition: Buccinators: The muscles in the cheek that are used for sucking or blowing.
meanings.sent1: When you blow up a balloon, your buccinators help push the air out.
meanings.sent2: The baby made funny faces, puffing out its cheeks as its buccinators worked.
meanings.sent3: The buccinators got a workout when the child tried to blow bubbles with a straw.
meanings.sent4: Her buccinators felt sore after a day of playing the trumpet in the school band.
meanings.sent5: The buccinators are like little helpers in your cheeks, assisting with blowing out birthday candles.

meanings.definition: Buccinators: A type of mollusk with a large, spiral shell.
meanings.sent1: At the beach, we found a beautiful buccinators shell and decided to keep it.
meanings.sent2: The buccinators we saw in the aquarium had stunning patterns on their shells.
meanings.sent3: The buccinators in the tank seemed to be having a conversation with each other.
meanings.sent4: The buccinators shell was so big, it could fit in the palm of my hand.
meanings.sent5: The buccinators' shell looked like a miniature staircase, spiraling upwards.
